# gt Table of Random Happiness Data

```{r fake_data, echo=FALSE}

gender <- rbinom(8, 1, .5)
vote <- rbinom(8, 1, .5)
data = tibble(gender, vote)

table <- data %>% 
  gt() %>%
  tab_header(
    title = "Voter Turnout",
    subtitle = "Measured by Gender"
  ) %>%
  fmt_number(columns = vars(vote)
             ) %>%
  tab_footnote(footnote = "0 = didn't vote, 1 = voted)", locations = cells_column_labels(columns = vars(vote))) %>%
  tab_footnote(footnote = "0 = Male, 1 = Female", locations = cells_column_labels(columns = vars(gender))) %>%
  cols_label(
    gender = "Gender",
    vote = "Voter Turnout",
    
  ) %>%
  cols_align("center")

table

model <- lm(vote ~ gender, data = data )

```

# Regression Table Explaining Voter Turnout as a Function of Gender 

```{r regression-table, results="asis", echo=FALSE}

stargazer(model, header = FALSE,
          dep.var.labels=c("vote"),
          covariate.labels=c("gender"))

```
